thread.title: Leger: AshleyMadison kills common sense

author: Robert Leger
title: Leger: AshleyMadison kills common sense
text:
The AshleyMadison.com data dump has just begun, and we already have potential accounts from a celebrity and thousands of government personnel. Yikes!
The “commons” continue to die.
The email addresses of 19 Arizona government employees are among those hacked from the marital cheating website AshleyMadison.com. Using your taxpayer-funded email to send a note to your spouse is one thing, but to cheat on him or her? So much for common sense.
The other possibility is someone borrowed the addresses; AshleyMadison doesn’t validate how people sign up. If that is what happened, it’s an affront to common decency.
Robert Leger Editor: Robert Leger oversees the opinions page, including The Republic's editorials and columns, your letters to the editor, My Turns and syndicated columnists. Believes the First Amendment means what it says. Raised in the desert, wandered to the Midwest, happy to have left the snow shovel and lawnmower behind. Mediocre golfer, decent mandolin player.
